column1: text

Sounds Good...Feels Good I got this the day it came out and im in love with it! 5sos have come a 
long way since when they were only playing for like 30 at most and now here 
they are playing for 2000+ people! I went to a ROWYSO show with my best 
friend and I will never forget that teenage memory[see what i did 
there.lol] for as long as i live! My favoriates are Vaopr,Castaway,Broken 
Home,San Fransisco and Waste the Night! Im so gkad i have these 4 guys in 
my life...they may not know me at all but they help me with a ton of 
things!

I love 5sos I've been here since 2013 and never plan on leaving the boys. They are my 
Sunshine's cliche but its true. Their albums just keep getting better and 
better!!

Everything about this album is amazing 5 seconds of summer puts out an amazing vibe that will make you feel good. 
All of these songs are completely beautiful and you can tell that they put 
so much work into their music. They try and make music that can relate to 
their fans and so far they did a really good jobs. Alot of these songs have 
so much emotion in them, I recommend invisible, catch fire, broke home, the 
girl who crys wolf, and broken home. This album really shows,not how only 
they grew as people but how they grew as song writers.

Im so excited! I love these boys to pieces! They have help me though so much and im so 
proud of them. I have watched them grow up and I just love them! The names 
are very interesting and I can wait to hear them! Im so proud of these 4 
dorks

Not as good as Love Songs, Drug Songs. X Ambassadors are the kind of bands that I'd want to see in concert more 
often, especially after hearing their last album. However, this album has 
the "VHS" segments in the album (7 total) that can drag on for too long in 
my opinion. The rest of the music is decent at best, except the obvious 
hits that captured the world by storm. VHs Is an album that any fan of X 
Ambassadors will enjoy, but not as much as I did with "Love Songs, Drug 
Songs."

X Ambassadors is So happy this album is finally out, I'd like to thank Imagine Dragons for 
having XA as their opening act in San Jose 2014. They're going to blow up 
with this album, music is so raw and original must listen

X Ambassadors In my opinion, Fear is tHE BEST SONG OF ALL TIME!!! That was the best 
colab in the history of ever and I just can't get over Imagine Dragons AND 
X Ambassadors!! TOGETHER!!! But overall their whole album is flipping 
awesome.

Renegade I really dont know any of the other songs but LOVE THE SONG RENEGADE i 
could listen to it all day. I like listening to it before i read a book 
because for the book im reading its a good song to have stuck in your head.

Fantastic Such a solid album. Great lyrics and a really different sound. It has been 
a long time since I have heard music like this that I enjoy to listen to 
whenever. These guys deserve to blow up and get huge.

VHS Almost a year later and this album is still as good as if it just came 
out. Fear is one of my favorite songs because it features Imagine Dragons. 
I love where X ambassadors are heading with their albums with the catchy 
lyrics and unbeatable beats. :) 5 stars all the way!

Good beats... but very rapey vibe The flow and beats of the songs are beyond excellent, but the lyrics are 
borderline childish. Its really an album about Breezy and Tyga getting 
girls in the most ridiculous ways. They believe alcohol and pot will get 
them with any girl. I wish they used the lyrics in more original way, but 
it sounds like a bunch of 17 year olds fantasizing about getting in bed 
with everyone and anyone.

collaboration, on this Album. This is most definitely sum that you can turn 
up too in the club!!!! Great work guys keep going hard, Fan of a Fan

Fan of a Fan Shows diversity the rhythm and blues side of it sizzles with a hint of 
raunchy and sexy igniting your primal desire for a bit of naughty play and 
fun while the hip hop keeps you fully charged with adrenaline massive beats 
charm the hidden dancer and rapper that lives in us all. Loved this one as 
much as the first collaborative.

Perfect blend of singing and rap Even though Tyga is average at best, CB carried more than enough weight 
with solid features to make this an awesome listen all the way into the 
summer. Banjo, Nothin' Like Me or Bunkin' will be in a nightclub near you!

Masterpiece Awesome collaboration...both Breezy and Tyga really brought unique talents 
to the table. This album in general has got er'thing; old-school, some 
funky, cali style and RnB slow type joints. Dope.

:/ Seriously ?!? The beats are on point. I'm ACTUALLY LISTENING to what

THIS ALBUM IS FIRE!!! Man I wish I never overlooked this album otherwise I would have been 
bought it a long time ago. I have this album on REPEAT almost everyday. 
This album is definitely better than the mixtape in all forms. Both clean 
and explicit versions are good but I had to go with this one cause it's 
uncensored. Awesome job love the album the beats and the collaboration is 
one of the best. My favorite song is She Goin' Up. Epic

I liked it but I thought the last mixtape they did together was fire. This album I really 
liked only 5 tracks on the album. Could been better, thought it was Lil 
rushed.

Two People Who's Music Blends Perfectly Tyga and Chris Brown are two of my favorite hip-hop artists. I love Tyga's 
flow, and the way he can go in on a song, and he makes really great covers 
on top of it. Then Chris Brown has really good vocals for the slower songs, 
and is also a pretty good rapper. These two have very similar styles, so 
they blend quite well. I'm looking forward to Fan of a Fan 2, if it ever 
releases. Great album.

Killed It Chris Brown is an amazing R&B artist. He's so talented. In my opinion, 
this album sounds SOOOOOOO much better, with him on it. I love Tyga. He and 
Breezy go perfectly together. Chris, you'll always be my favorite singer, 
R&B artist, everything! You're an amazing person. Don't stop, because it'll 
only get better and better, I know it. Love ya!

A showcase album of a modern great! Very rarely does an album's tracklist have you announcing "Chooon!!" out 
loud on reading each song down the list...this album, however, smashes that 
mould to smithereens with a sledge hammer and with devil horns aloft!! 
Bathe in a plethora of musical genius again and again as one hit follows 
another in a rollercoaster ride, showcasing the neck tingling power, 
passion and glory of one of the most consistently great bands of the last 
two decades!
